events.message: The policyholder reported a car accident that occurred on the highway involving another vehicle, which resulted in visible damages to the front bumper and headlights.
The submitted claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident based on the description and keywords specified by the claimant.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage the claim, ensuring the claimant has a direct point of contact throughout the claim process.
The claim was officially acknowledged and confirmation was sent to the customer affirming that the process has started.
The agent requested additional documents including the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and insurance card to proceed with the investigation.
The claimant submitted all requested documents promptly, including the police report and multiple images showing the extent of the collision damage.
The investigator began the claim review process by analyzing submitted evidence and contacting involved parties to verify facts.
The investigation concluded confirming the accident details and liability were consistent with the claimant's statement and documentation.
A settlement amount was proposed to the policyholder covering damages, rental car reimbursement, and other related expenses.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the settlement offer and appreciation for the agent's support throughout the claim handling.
The claim was formally approved by the insurance adjuster, confirming the proposed settlement will be honored.
The settlement payment was processed and issued to the claimant's account to cover repair costs and associated expenses.
After successful payment, the claim was closed and notification sent confirming no further action is required from the policyholder.
